name: 魏敏樺
objective:
1.Matrices, Vectors, Determinants. Linear System of Eqns.
2.Matrix Eigenvalue Problems
3.Vector
4.Fourier Analysis
schedule:
Week 1:　　Introduction
Week 2:　　6.1 Basic Concepts: Matrix Addition, Scalar Multiplication
         6.2 Matrix Multiplication 
Week 3:　　6.3 Linear System of Eqns. Gauss Elimination
         6.4 Rank of Matrix. Linear Independence.
Week 4: 　　6.5 Solutions of Linear Systems: Existence, Uniqueness, General Form
         6.6 Determinants. Cramer’s Rule
Week 5:　　6.7 Inverse of a Matrix. Gauss-Jordan Elimination
Week 6:　　7.1 Eigenvalues, Eigenvectors
　　7.3 Symmetric, Skew-Symmetric, and Orthogonal Matrices
Week 7: 　　7.4 Complex Matrices: Hermitian, Skew-Hermitian, Unitary
　　7.5 Similarity of Matrices. Diagonalization
Week 8: 　　8.1 Vector Algebra in 2-Space and 3-Space
         8.2 Inner Product (Dot Product)
Week 9:　　Midterm
Week 10: 8.3 Vector Product (Cross Product)
         8.4 Vector and Scalar Functions and Fields. Derivatives
Week 11:　　8.8 Gradient of a Scalar Field. Directional Derivative
Week 12: 10.1 Periodic Functions. Trigonometric Series
         10.2 Fourier Series
Week 13: 10.3 Functions of Any Period p = 2L
         10.4 Even and Odd Functions. Half-Range Expansions
Week 14: 10.5 Complex Fourier Series
         10.6 Forced Oscillations
Week 15: 10.7 Approximation by Trigonometric Polynomials
         10.8 Fourier Integrals
Week 16: 10.9 Fourier Cosine and Sine Transforms
         10.10 Fourier Transform
Week 17: Revisions
Week 18: Final Exam
materials:
Erwin Kreyszig (1999). Advanced Engineering Mathematics. John Wiley & Sons, Inc.

Peter O’Neil (1995). Advanced Engineering Mathematics. Brooks/Cole Publishing Company.
